summary: This is an email from an individual with the initials 'S' to a US Attorney's Office (likely Southern District of New York) contractor, requesting to lock access to non-responsive documents in the 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' database. The email discusses document review metrics, indicating 397,365 non-responsive documents and 1,218,719 responsive documents.

events.title: Request to Lock Database Access
events.description: An email is sent requesting to lock off access to 397,365 non-responsive documents in the 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' database, leaving only 1,218,719 responsive documents accessible.

keyFacts: The email references a document database for the case 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)', likely related to search warrant returns.
The database contains a total of at least 1,616,084 documents (397,365 non-responsive + 1,218,719 responsive).
A responsiveness review has been completed, resulting in the identification of 1,218,719 documents tagged as 'Identified Responsive'.
The request is to restrict access to the nearly 400,000 documents deemed non-responsive to the case.
The communication is between a case team member and a contractor for the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
